#summary OpenPGM : C Reference : pgm_create_str_gsi()
#labels Phase-Implementation

_Function_
=== Declaration ===
<pre>
#include <pgm/pgm.h>

int *pgm_create_str_gsi* (
	[OpenPgmCReferencePgmGsiT pgm_gsi_t]`*`    gsi,
	const char`*`   str,
	[http://library.gnome.org/devel/glib/stable/glib-Basic-Types.html#gssize gssize]               length,
	);
</pre>

=== Purpose ===
Create a GSI based on MD5 of provided string.

=== Parameters ===

<table border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0">
<tr>
<th>Parameter</th>
<th>Description</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><tt>gsi</tt></td>
<td>A pointer to the GSI provided by the application that the function will fill.</td>
</tr><td>
<td><tt>str</tt></td>
<td>Text string.</td>
</tr><td>
<td><tt>length</tt></td>
<td>Length of <tt>str</tt>, or 0 for NULL terminated string.</td>
</tr>
</table>


=== Return Value ===
On success, 0 is returned.  If <tt>gsi</tt> is an invalid address, <tt>-EINVAL</tt> is returned.

=== Example ===
{{{
 pgm_gsi_t gsi;
 pgm_create_str_gsi (&gsi, "101 Acacia Avenue", 0);
}}}
